item.title: Technology Watch
item.description:
“Veille Technologique” (VT)

Promotion: ING3 SCIA & ING3 IF (30 students) Year: 2023-2024
Institution: EPITA Lyon
Hours: 7h CM, 5h TD, 18h Project
Responsibilities: Designed courses, assessments, and project coaching. Assigned mentors to project groups.
Description: Covered technology watch, knowledge transmission and public speaking. Evaluated through project progress, pedagogical output, and final presentations.

Student Projects

As part of this course, students synthesized their research into educational resources to communicate their findings effectively. Below are selected projects showcasing their work. Please note that the resources are in French:

  • La Frugalité des IA : Mindmap
  • Mirai: Le deep learning pour prédire les risques de cancer du sein: Prezi Presentation
  • Les LLMs sont-ils conscients ? Explorez la théorie des modèles: Canva Presentation
  • How do games simulate water? | A non-exhaustive guide made by a bush: YouTube Video
  • L’IOT dans l’industrie: YouTube Video
  • Real-time Statistical Analysis of Football: Website

item.title: Introduction to Machine Learning
item.description:
“Introduction à l’Apprentissage Automatique” (IAA)

Promotion: 1st year of engineering (ING1) (35 students) Year: 2022-2023
Institution: EPITA Lyon
Hours: 8h CM, 2h TD, 2h TP
Responsibilities: Created lectures, tutorials, practical sessions, and assessments.
Description: Covered supervised (classification, regression) and unsupervised (clustering) learning and model evaluation. Grading was based on a project, a written article published on Pop’Sciences and a final exam.

item.title: Graph Data Mining
item.description:
Graph Data Mining (GDM)

Promotion: ING2 SCIA (20 students) Year: 2022-2023 Institution: EPITA Lyon
Hours: 3h CM, 6h TP Responsibilities: Created a lecture and practical session, supervised projects.
Description: Covered community detection and pattern discovery in graphs. Students participated in a one-day hackathon.

item.title: Language Typology
item.description:
“Typologie des langages” (TYLA)

Promotion: ING1 (110 students)
Year: 2022-2023 Institution: EPITA Lyon
Hours: 12h CM
Responsibilities: Delivered lectures with pre-defined content.
Description: Provided general knowledge on the history of computer science and programming languages, analyzing key aspects of different programming paradigms.

item.title: Biostatistics and Bioinformatics
item.description:
“Biostatistiques et bioinformatique” (BIO2006L)

Promotion: L3 Life Sciences, Bioinformatics track (20 students)
Year: 2021-2022 Institution: Univ. Lyon 1 UFR Biosciences
Hours: 45h TP
Responsibilities: Delivered five 3-hour practical sessions to three different student groups. Created complementary slides shared with other instructors.
Description: Students used prediction tools to analyze a DNA fragment and understand a genetic disease.

item.title: Data Mining
item.description:
“Data Mining” (INF2355M)

Promotion: M2 Data Science (60 students in TD & TP)
Year: 2021-2022 Institution: Univ. Lyon 1 Département d’Informatique
Hours: 8h TD, 6h TP
Responsibilities: Designed a project combining TD and TP.
Description: Students worked in groups to develop a data mining tool, using an academic paper and Git repository to create tutorials and summaries for future research applications.

item.title: Knowledge Discovery in Data
item.description:
“Découverte de connaissances dans les données” (INF2418M)

Promotion: M2 Information Technologies and Web (TIW) & M2 Bioinformatics (50 students)
Year: 2021-2022 Institution: Univ. Lyon 1 Département d’Informatique
Hours: 2h CM, 2h TP
Responsibilities: Created and delivered lectures and practical sessions.
Description: The lecture introduced machine learning, while the practical session was a tutorial on Natural Language Processing (NLP). Used interactive tools like Wooclap for in-class engagement.

item.title: Advanced Databases
item.description:
“Bases de données avancées” (INF3048L)

Promotion: L3 Computer Science (30 students in TD, 15 in TP)
Year: 2020-2021 Institution: Univ. Lyon 1 Département d’Informatique
Hours: 20h TD, 36h TP
Responsibilities: Led a tutorial group, supervised two TP groups, and graded exams. Exercises were predefined by the course coordinator.
Description: Covered relational database design and SQL, PLSQL, and XML programming.

item.title: Psychophysiology of Perception
item.description:
“Psychophysiologie de la perception” (BIO2363M)

Promotion: M2 Neurophysiology of Perception and Sensory Evaluation (20 students) Year: 2020-2021
Institution: Univ. Lyon 1 UFR Biosciences
Hours: 2h CM
Responsibilities: Created and delivered the course (online).
Description: Introduction to data science applied to neurophysiology. Students completed a survey before and after the course to assess their perception of data science and its applications in their field. The shift in responses was encouraging.

item.title: NeuroConferences
item.description:
“NeuroConférences” (BIO2357M)

Promotion: M2 Fundamental and Clinical Neurosciences (100 students) Year: 2020-2021
Institution: Univ. Lyon 1, UFR Biosciences
Hours: 1.5h CM
Responsibilities: Course preparation with live demonstrations of various data science software.
Description: General introduction to accessible data science tools for neuroscientists.
